item.post_title: 10 Tips to design a effective business card:
item.post_content:
Though the world is marching towards going paperless more and more, business cards still holds an important place when it comes to business. Business cards are considered as the key marketing tool even today.

A business card measuring 2 inches by 3.5 inches must be designed to convey overall image of the business at a single glance. However a business card cannot tell the whole story of a company, but must create a professional image to the people outside.

1. Fundamentals of a business card:

The first and foremost fundamental of a business card is to have all the information right

  • Name
  • Designation
  • Company name
  • Email
  • Phone number

Knowing to striking a right balance between text and visuals is necessary. It is important to think where the eye lands first in a business card and designing it accordingly is another tip to be kept in mind.

2. Special Finishes:

An instant way to attract using a business card is by using special finishes which includes foil blocking, spot –UV, metallic inks etc..It is important to make the business card more tactile, impressive visually and must be unforgettable. There are many printing companies who offer different options. Take some time to talk to them before finalizing.

3. Shape of the card:

Another great way to create an impression using the business card is by giving it a beautiful cut. One can use die to change the shape of the card by rounding the corners or by just cutting shapes from the centre. Die-cutting allows cutting out any shape and in bulk. There are many professionals who help in designing a better business card. It is always a better idea to talk to them and gain some knowledge before finalizing a design.

4. Materials used:

Although most business cards are printed on cards one can choose to get more creative. There are many options available including plastic, wood or even slate. Different materials comes with different pricing it is important to analyse and decide the one that does not burn your pocket

5. Choose a font:

The font used in a business card is as important as the design, material and the finish. A right font used will not irritate the client and will make them go through the business card completely. Making them glued to card a little longer will make them remember the business.

6. Make it useful:

There is lots of paper around everybody in the form of news papers, magazine, books, note books, flyers, pamphlets etc. There are few people who hold of every bit of paper that they receive but few are ruthless and throw away in the first opportunity. To avoid such risks one can be a little more creative while designing a calling card. For instance one can design a business card as a holder for simple things like clips, needles etc.. or as a miniature phone holder.

7. Do not use it like a brochure:

Though it is necessary to have all important information in a business card, but should never be used as a brochure. If one likes to put in a little more information on the business card, the backside of the card can be used.

8. Look after the cards:

Business cards must be maintained well to keep its sheen. Maintaining them using a card holder will help business cards stay in shape.

9. Recycle:

As the business grows the business cards also takes different shape. Old business cards can be given new life by recycling them. There are lots of professionals in the market who can help recreating the old business cards into new ones. Spend some time and let the creativity flow.

10. Say no to errors:

As business cards are a great means of marketing for a business it is important to keep it free of errors. There can be nothing worse than having a typo in the email address or name. It is important to double check before sending it for printing.

item.post_title: A guide to trouble shoots your air conditioner:
item.post_content:
Have you ever asked yourself “Hey is the AC working?” after the first season? It is better to address it before the mercury soars. Like any other appliance air conditioner also needs little maintenance now and then for it to perform well.

So here is a simple guide to identify common problems and to troubleshoot them. This simple guide will help you save few hundred bucks on AC repair.

  1. Dirty filter:

Regardless of the type of air conditioner used a clogged filter will arrest air flow. This eventually leads to low efficiency and reduces the ability to effectively cool the air. It is mandatory to check the air filters periodically and clean them. Since centralized AC’s run continuously the filters get clogged up much faster. It is mandatory to check them and clean them every month.Filters must be checked periodically even when there are pets at home.

2. Sunny inside?

By installing a AC unit in a room that receives most sunlight then the unit has to work much harder to cool the air in the room. A better solution to it is to move it to a shadier space or by keeping the shades or curtains drawn helps prevent the rooms getting heated up.

3. Leakage of warm air:

The seals around the AC have to be checked now and then to ensure hot air is not getting in or cool air is not seeping out. It is necessary to reseal the unit with weather strip. It is always better to use manufacturer’s installation and safety hardware.

4. Vibrating window AC:

The whirl of the fan, sound of the compressor cycling on and off, and Air conditioners makes lots of noise. These are considered as normal. But when you hear a vibrating sound then this means the unit is not installed properly. It is necessary to reinstall the unit according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

5. Checking thermostat setting:

Air conditions, these days come with smart or programmable thermostats. This helps you to easily control the temperature to a comfortable setting when you are in and a bit higher temperature when you are not in the room. It is important to make sure the thermostat is not exposed to direct sunlight which may cause the machine to register wrong temperature.

6. Check the registers:

By regularly cleaning the registers of dust you can experience good performance of the AC. It is also necessary to check the registers in the air conditioners are not blocked by furniture or other objects that stops easy air flow.

7. Plants and compressors:

The outdoor compressor must be free of any disturbances caused by plants or building structure for proper air flow. One has to make sure that there are at least 2 or 3 feet space between the compressor and any other object. There has to be at least 5 feet clearance between the top of the unit and any other object.

8. Annual check up:

Finally, an annual check up by a heating, ventilation and air conditioning expert (HVAC) will help determine serious problems on time.

Are you one among those people who believe vegan diet can be a hurdle when it comes to fitness goals? The answer is a big “NO”. By following a proper regime and having a professional fitness expert next to you, achieving your fitness goals becomes easier.

Breaking those myths:

There are lots of myths that revolve around veganism and fitness. One of the greatest myths is that one cannot achieve fitness goals by following vegan diet. Whereas many people who follow plant-based diet stay in great shape and achieve fitness goals far more easily.

Making food your best friend:

Making food your friend is a healthy habit. Emotions are closely tied to what we eat. Following a plant based food leads to quick weigh loss as it is absorbed more quickly into the system. When you try to shift to plant based life style it is important to consume more meals in order to maintain certain level of energy and weight.

Alkaline foods do the magic:

Generally a plant based diet is considered to be alkaline in nature. Unlike acidic foods like meat or dairy products which increases acidity of the blood. Alkaline foods help body to flourish and enable faster post work out recovery. So when you are in the process of recovery it is necessary to consume more alkaline foods.

Is all vegan food healthy?

The answer to the question might shock many. There is a category of vegan food called junk food. Taking vegan pizza or a burger every day will definitely not help you achieve your fitness goals or a six pack will not appear. To achieve your goal to shred some weight you have to adhere to a strict, healthy vegan diet.

The power of protein:

There is a misconception among people that by following a vegan diet, one cannot get complete protein. There are many foods that are considered as good sources of protein, some of them are hemp, nut-based milk, nuts and seeds, quinoa, tofu, lentils, seitan and beans that can help you to going.

Do not get addicted to food:

Yes! food can be a most addictive thing that we pump into our bodies. If you try to cut down animal based diet that has been consumed for many years would definitely give you withdrawal symptoms. But this is not something to worry about, these are the ways of body detoxifying itself. Just hold on for a while and you will be amazed to note the body getting adjusted to the change.

Stay positive:

Being positive and clinging to it for a while is a herculean task. Doubts would arise as people around you might discourage you for your decision of going vegan. When you are in a spree of changing lifestyle many people around you might not support you. This might leave you a little low but keeping the spirits up and going will enable you to achieve your fitness goals. Hire a fitness expert as they can help you identify what your body needs and plan workout based on it. Get ready to experience an incredible transition.
